description: The president's critics say he could've been referring to himself.
title: Trump Gets A Fact-Check After Blaming Coronavirus On â€˜Somebody A Long Time Agoâ€™
title_page: Trump Gets A Fact-Check After Blaming Coronavirus On â€˜Somebody A Long Time Agoâ€™ | HuffPost
maintext:
President Donald Trump praised his administrationâ€™s work on the coronavirus pandemic as â€œincredibleâ€ on Monday despite repeated missteps, including long delays in dispensing test kits. Then he attempted to shift the blame to a nameless â€œsomebodyâ€ from â€œa long time ago.â€
â€œThere has been so much unnecessary death in this country,â€ Trump said, adding:
â€œIt could have been stopped and it could have been stopped short, but somebody a long time ago, it seems, decided not to do it that way. And the whole world is suffering because of it.â€
Based on his comments at another point in the event, Trump was likely referring to China.
â€œWe are not happy with China,â€ he said, adding that the spread of the infection could have been â€œstopped at the sourceâ€ if Beijing had taken earlier action.
But given Trumpâ€™s own history and his administrationâ€™s delays in acting to slow the spread of the virus, critics were quick to point out that the president couldâ€™ve been talking about himself.
On Feb. 26, Trump predicted the number of U.S. cases would be â€œdown to close to zero,â€ and on Feb. 27, he said the infection would disappear â€œlike a miracle.â€ To date, more than 988,000 Americans have been diagnosed with COVID-19 and at least 50,000 Americans with the virus have died.
Trump also repeatedly promised tests that didnâ€™t materialize:
